oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Pulsebeat Radio Show: David Lynn Jones - Part 1
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: The recording is of Kim Spangler (host) dictating the Pulsebeat section of the Voice of the Heartland Radio Show. The episode interviews David Lynn Jones (musician). The episode was set to air for the week of July 25, 1988. The episode is part 1 of 2.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Kim Spangler; David Lynn Jones
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (00:01) Kim Spangler introduces the upcoming David Lynn Jones Pulsebeat show -- (00:50) Spangler reveals how she visited Jones at his small home in Arkansas -- (01:46) Jones reflects on how surprised he was that Willie Nelson chose his song to record -- (02:22) Living in the Promised Land (Willie Nelson) -- (05:20) Spangler introduces the commercial break -- (05:35) Spangler introduces Jones who reflects on experiencing large cities -- (06:18) The Rouge (David Lynn Jones) -- (09:56) Spangler greets the new networks -- (10:14) Ron Olson and David Page discuss the news of the week including: Gilley's court battle and a Michigan-based concert -- (11:30) Jones is introduced by Spangler to discuss how "Bonnie Jean" was written for his daughter -- (12:15) Bonnie Jean (David Lynn Jones) -- (15:28) Spangler and Jones discuss Jones' Mother's reaction to the album -- (16:31) Home of My Heart (David Lynn Jones) -- (19:52) Spangler introduces the commercial break -- (20:11) Spangler reveals that Charlie Daniels was one of the first people who took a chance on Jones -- (20:50) Stay All Night (Stay a Little Longer) (Charlie Daniels) -- (24:25) Unidentified tune [featuring Kim Spangler outro discussion] ([Unidentified])
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Spangler, Kim; Jones, David Lynn;
